DOC.brief_summary: This study is being conducted to assess the effect of indacaterol (150 μg o.d.) on inspiratory capacity (IC), using placebo and open label tiotropium (18 μg o.d.) as comparators in patients with moderate chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). In particular, spirometric timepoints are included to elucidate the peak-IC in a period of approximately 4 hour post inhalation
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Indacaterol on Inspiratory Capacity (IC)
DOC.criteria: Cooperative outpatients with a diagnosis of COPD (moderate as classified by the GOLD Guidelines, 2008) and including: Smoking history of at least 10 pack years Postbronchodilator FEV1 <80% and ≥50% of the predicted normal value (Visit 2). Postbronchodilator FEV1/forced vital capacity (FVC) <70% (Visit 2). Patients who received any corticosteroid (including inhaled) for 3 months prior to screening Other protocoldefined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply
